page.title: 13HIGHDOWN HILL cont.
page.content: People were attracted to Highsown by the {chalk gardens} , the views, the garden's ponds, the open space, the peace and quiet, the availability of refreshment after a walk due to the little cafe next to the garden. Any changes that were commented on were seen to be for the better, for example the new cafe and the improved gardens. Despite the tremendous amount of people using Highdown, the amount of abuse in terms of litter was very small. It seemed most people respected the ground and treated it well. Other things of interest on the hill are the {Anglo-Saxon }burial ground, Britain's first export commodity in the {neolithic flint mines} and also the {miller's tomb}.(See Ferring)
